DataElement.preferredName: New Malignant Neoplasm Donor And/Or Cellular Therapy Product Derivation Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the new malignant neoplasm was donor/cell product derived.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: New Malignant Neoplasm Donor And/Or Cellular Therapy Product Derivation Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy._A thing produced by or resulting from a process. EXAMPLE(S): drug, device. The FDA list of regulated products: animal and human drugs; therapeutic biologics; allergenics; cell, tissue and gene therapy products; blood components; blood derivative products; devices; and animal (pets and livestock) and human food/feed (medicated and un-medicated); cosmetics; pet treats; and dietary supplements._The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: New Malignant Neoplasm Tissue Donor And/Or Cellular Therapy Product Derivation
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.
The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
